blocks.innerHtml: This game, Battleships, was created in C with a project partner for one of my University courses, ENCE 260 (Computer Systems), during Semester 2 of 2020. The project itself received an A- (84%) grade for the course.

Battleships can be played with two players using two ATmega32U2 microcontrollers via IR transmitters, each with a 5Ã—7 LED display. To start, each player must choose the positions of three ships, each of different sizes, using a joystick and button. Once both players have chosen, the game of Battleships starts. Each player can check the status of their own ships and shoot a shot when it is their turn until the game is complete.
